meanings.definition: The ability of a substance to provoke an immune response.
meanings.sent1: The immunogenicity of the vaccine helped protect the body from harmful germs.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the immunogenicity of different compounds to develop effective treatments.
meanings.sent3: The immunogenicity of the flu shot made the virus regret trying to invade the body.
meanings.sent4: The immunogenicity of the new medication was like a superhero activating the immune system's defenses.
meanings.sent5: The immunogenicity of the allergen was like a loud alarm waking up the immune cells to fight off intruders.

meanings.definition: The quality of being able to stimulate an immune response.
meanings.sent1: The immunogenicity of the protein was crucial for triggering the body's defense mechanisms.
meanings.sent2: Doctors consider the immunogenicity of vaccines when designing effective immunization schedules.
meanings.sent3: The immunogenicity of the bacteria was so persuasive, even the immune system couldn't resist.
meanings.sent4: The immunogenicity of the pathogen was like a magnet drawing the attention of the immune cells.
meanings.sent5: The immunogenicity of the virus was like a spark igniting the immune response to fight off the infection.
